shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 3r-128va) I-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 3r-97v) I-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 97v-108r) I-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 108r-114r) I-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 114ra-123va) I-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 123va-128va)
Additio 1.

donors.donor: Additio 1 mentions Wälättä Qwǝsqwam as the donor.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn and shows traces of intensive use. The sewing is damaged. The front board is broken and repaired. Hole skillfully amended on fol. 4.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board is broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires.

squires.squire:
A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(10/fols. 3r-12v) – ፪II(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9/fols. 13r-21v) – ፫III(10/fols. 22r-31v) – ፬IV(10/fols. 32r-41v) – ፭V(10/fols. 42r-51v) – ፮VI(10/fols. 52r-61v) – ፯VII(10; s.l.: 4, stub after 7; 7, stub after 4/fols. 62r-71v) – ፰VIII(11; s.l.: 10, stub after 1/fols. 72r-82v) – ፱IX(10/fols. 83r-92v) – ፲X(10/fols. 93r-102v) – ፲፩XI(10/fols. 103r-112v) – ፲፪XII(10/fols. 113r-122v) – ፲፫XIII(2/fols. 123r-124v) – XIV(4/fols. 125r-128v).
Quire XIII is loosely inserted between quires XII and XIV.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-1, I-2, I-3: all data are for fol. 4r.
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts I-4, I-5: all data are for fol. 115r
taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra (name of God in Texts I-1, I-2; name of St. Mary in Texts I-4, I-5); traditional titles, numbers and every second line of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; name and interpretation of the Hebrew letter of Ps. 118; letter ስ in the abbreviation እስ in Ps. 135; letters ግ, አ, ሔ in the word እግዚአብሔር in Pss. 78, 112, 145; elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements; a few lines on the incipit page of Text I-1; two group of lines on the incipit pages of Texts I-4, I-5; two initial lines of each section of Texts I-4; initial words of each section of Text I-5; incipit of the inscription on fol. 3r.

abbreviations.abbreviation:
እስ᎓ for እስመ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ ምሕረቱ᎓ (Ps. 135, fols. 89v-90r) ስ᎓ for ስቡሕኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ወልዑልኒ᎓ ውእቱ᎓ ለዓለም᎓ (Canticle 10, fol. 105r-v)
Text I-4 ሰ፤ ለ፤ ቅ፤ for ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት (e.g., fols. 114ra, 115rb, 117vb) Words or their abbreviations stand for the whole refrain: ሠ፡ for ሠረቀ፡ በሥጋ፡ እምድንግል፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ዘርአ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአድኅነነ፡ (fols. 114ra-vb) እ᎓ for እስመ፡ በፈቃዱ፡ ወበሥምረቱ፡ አቡሁ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ መጽአ፡ ወአድኅነነ (e.g., fols.115ra-116va) ኵ፡/ኵሉ፡ for ኵሉ፡ ትውልድ፡ ያስተበፅዑኪ፡ ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ (fols. 116va-118rb) ናዓ፡ for ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ። እስመ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ይኵን፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵልነ (fols. 118rb-120ra) ለኪ፡ for ለኪ፡ ለበሕቲትኪ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ እመ፡ ብርሃን፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ በስብሐት፡ ወበውዳሴ (fols. 120ra-121rb) ተ፡/ተፈ፡ for ተፈሥሒ፡ ኦምልዕልተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እስመ፡ ረከብኪ፡ ሞገስ፡ ተፈሥሒ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ምስሌኪ (fols. 121rb-122rb) ወ፡/ወበ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 122va-123va)
Text I-5 ወ፤ ሣ፤ ይ፤ ሰ፤ ቅ፤ for ወልድኪ፡ ሣህሎ፡ ይክፍለነ፡ ሰአሊ፡ ለነ፡ ቅድስት (e.g., fols. 123vb, 125vb, 126ra) The words or abbreviations stand for the whole refrain. በእ፡/በእንተ፡ for ወበእንተዝ፡ ናዓብየኪ፡ ኵልነ፡ ኦእግዝእትነ፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ንጽሕት፡ ኵሎ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናንቀዓዱ፡ ከመ፡ ንርከብ፡ ሣህለ፡ በኀበ፡ መፍቀሬ፡ ሰብእ (fols. 123va-126ra)

otherdetails.otherdetail: - Text I-1 begins with a short ʾarke-hymn (?): ዛቲ፡ መዘሙረ፡ ዳዊት፡...

additional.cont: Fol. 128va: Donation note.
additional.det: The note mentions Wälätä Qwǝsqwam as the donor. Besides, names of her family members are listed.

extras.extra: - The Pss. are divided into groups of ten by elaborate ornamental bands or chains of black and red dots. - Different names are inserted in the text in a secondary hand; e.g., fols. 87v, 108r, 114r. - Passages written in smaller script: e.g., fols. 20v, 75v, 76r. - Tämälläs-signs indicating the place where the omissions, written in a secondary hand in the upper margins, belong: fols. 33r l.8, 126r l.8. - The line is often taken up: e.g., fols. 3r, 36r, 53r. - Corrections written interlineally: e.g., fols. 14v, 18r, 89v. - Corrections written in the upper margins: fols. 27, 60v. - Immediate corrections indicated by thin broken lines above and below the word: fols. 29v, 125va. - Scribbles and doodles: fols. 1r-v, 2r-v, 124r-v. - A passage erased: fol. 11r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire marks are written in the upper left margin of fols. 13r, 22r, 32r, 42r, 52r, 62r, 72r, 83r, 93r, 103r, 113r, 123r.

frames.frame: - Fol. 3r (incipit of Text I-1): elaborate coloured (black, red, vivid lime green) ornamental frame; geometric and floral motifs. - Fols. 14v, 20v, 28v, 34v, 65v, 97v, 108r: elaborate ornamental bands separating: group of 10 Pss., Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat, Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy and Wǝddase Maryam; geometric and floral motifs.
